subject: Critical Thinking
title: A Brief History of Fallacy Hunting
description: A quick win: understand A Brief History of Fallacy Hunting.

hook.text: Aristotle was the first fallacy hunter. His 'Sophistical Refutations' in 350 BC was the original myth-busting guide.

buildup.text: He identified tricks used by Sophists â€” paid teachers of persuasion who cared about winning, not truth.

discovery.text: Medieval scholars expanded the list. John Stuart Mill, Bentham, and Schopenhauer added new categories in the 1800s.

twist.text: Today we have over 100 named fallacies. Yet political ads, social media, and daily arguments use the same ancient ones.

climax.text: The tools to detect flawed reasoning have existed for 2,400 years. We just don't teach them in school.

punchline.text: Aristotle gave us the playbook. We forgot to read it.

quiz.question: Who first systematically cataloged logical fallacies?
